title: 4th arrest made in shooting death of Tyson Gay's daughter
content:
The Lexington Police Department says it arrested a fourth man Wednesday in connection with the fatal shooting of 15-year-old Trinity Gay, the daughter of Olympic sprinter Tyson Gay.
The shooting happened on Sunday in a restaurant parking lot in Lexington. Police say 20-year-old Lamonte Williams is charged with wanton endangerment. Officers say he and the three others who have been charged — Chazerae Taylor, D’Markeo Taylor, and Dvonta Middlebrooks — fired multiple gunshots at the time the 15-year-old girl was hit. The three others were arrested Sunday, and were each charged with wanton endangerment.
Funeral arrangements were announced Wednesday for the teen. Visitation will be held from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. on Saturday, Oct. 22 at Southland Christian Church on Harrodsburg Road in Nicholasville, Kentucky.The funeral will also be held at Southland Christian Church at 12 p.m. on Saturday. Interment is planned for 12 p.m. on Monday, Oct. 24, at Greenwood Cemetery in Russellville, Kentucky.
To read the obituary for Trinity Gay, click here.
